message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SI 

The paper deals with the problem of detecting botnets, which is a major concern in the field of computer security (cs.CR). The proposed approach involves tracking the network activity of hosts over time using a neural network architecture (cs.NI). The use of a Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) based neural network also suggests the involvement of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also evaluates the performance of the proposed approach on a dataset, which involves machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper proposes a generalizable detection methodology, which could be relevant to the field of systems and information theory (cs.SI).
